etymology.description: semantic: 辵 ‘walk’ + phonetic: 土; later as 彳 + 走.
etymology.interpretation: Walking/motion is supplied by the 辵 element, while 土 contributed the sound in Old Chinese. The later graphic shift to 彳 + 走 reinforces senses like moving on foot and, by extension, a follower or apprentice who “goes along” after a teacher.

parts.english: to walk; to go; to leave

examples.chinese: 他是木匠的徒弟(他是木匠的徒弟)。
寺里有许多信徒(寺裡有許多信徒)。
examples.english: There are many followers in the temple.

examples.chinese: 我们徒步穿过山谷(我們徒步穿過山谷)。
examples.english: We went on foot through the valley.
